definitions: A class of cold-blooded, air-breathing vertebrate animals distinguished by having a dry, scaly skin, typically laying soft-shelled eggs on land, and including snakes, lizards, crocodiles, turtles, and tortoises.
In some classifications, a superorder or subclass within the Vertebrata.
examples: The study focused on the evolution of Reptilia.
Many species within Reptilia are endangered.
Reptilia represents a diverse group of animals.
